messages.message:
Hello everyone and anyone,
I recently merged a PR which updated moment.js in webpacked to the latest version, and I was trying to backport it to the release branches. Does anyone know why the CI/the tests might be failing https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/51827/files?

What I did is `npm install moment@latest`
Now im running `make build && make test` locally to test this and half of the snapshots fail

Can anyone help?

it looks like it’s caused by a bunch of snapshot unit tests failing. Can you try running jest with `--updateSnapshot` locally?

weird that the snapshots are not working though cuz an earlier PR against that branch should’ve caused these tests to fail too

Thanks! That helped with the snapshots failing, but I think the CI is now failing just from the normal unit tests? https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/instabase/job/PR-51827/7/console. From the logs I also dont think this is related to my version bump? But maybe someone who knows more can confirm
i think the yarn.lock might actually have changed a LOT of stuff. can you revert that file and try to use yarn instead? The diff right now is too big for me to reasonably give suggestions
